{"id":1231234707,"question_id":3390,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"2Â months","timestamp":1713019550,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"5 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1231234707/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Rectangles to Cover Points","memory":"97.9 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minRectanglesToCoverPoints(int[][] points, int w) {\n        \n        int len = points.length;\n        \n        int ed = points[0][0];\n        int st = ed;\n        \n        int res = 0 ;\n        \n        Arrays.sort(points, (a,b)-> a[0]-b[0]);\n        \n        \n        \n        \n        for(int i=0; i<len; i++){\n            \n            int x = points[i][0];\n            int y = points[i][1];\n            \n            int j=i;\n            while(j+1<len && points[j+1][0]-x<=w){\n                j++;\n            }\n            \n            res++;\n            i=j;\n        }\n        \n        \n        int resb = 0;\n        \n        for(int i=len-1; i>=0; i--){\n              \n            int x = points[i][0];\n            int y = points[i][1];\n            \n            int j=i;\n            while(j-1>=0 && points[j-1][0]-x>=w){\n                j--;\n            }\n            \n            resb++;\n            i=j;\n            \n            \n        }\n        \n        return Math.min(res, resb);\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-rectangles-to-cover-points","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
